dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRETTY YOUNG WOMAN is standing on the street corner wai for a bus. She's carrying books and looking very collegia A black stretch LIMOUSINE with darkened windows drives pa SLAMS ON ITS BRAKES, and backs up. The Young Woman stares her reflection in the windows, wondering what this is all about. Finally, the REAR PASSENGER WINDOW zips down, revealing L CHRISTMAS, age 30. He's a pleasant-enough looking guy, if little shaggy. He's wearing a dark suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the medical school? I'm supposed to be giving a lecture in twenty minutes and my driver's a bit lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy European accent) Go straight aheads and makes a left over za bridge. Lloyd checks out her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't help noticing the accent. You from Jersey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unimpressed) Austria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austria? You're kidding. (mock-Australian accent) Well, g'day, mate. What do you say we get together later and throw a few shrimp on the barbie. The Young Woman turns her back to him and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) Guess I won't be going Down Under tonight... He SIGHS and zips the window back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd climbs through the driver's partition into the fron seat. Then he puts a CHAUFFEUR'S CAP on his head and driv away. We see that HE'S THE DRIVER! The dispatch radio CRACKLES TO LIFE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v.o.) Carr 22, come in, car 22... Lloyd grabs his CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22, where the hell are you, Lloyd? You're running late on the East Side pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool your jets, Arnie. I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v.o.) Well hurry it up. And make sure you park legally. One more ticket and your ass is history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This building is white with black spots on it, like a DALMATION. Over the front door is an awning shaped like a DOG'S SNOUT, whiskers included. A van pulls up outside. The vehicle is decorated like a GIANT POODLE, with four l hanging off the sides, a tail in the rear, and a dog's sn on the front grill. MUTT CUTS is written on the side of i HARRY DUNNE climbs out. He's in his early 30s and dressed a ridiculous BEAGLE COSTUME, including a CAP WITH FLOPPY EARS. He goes to the rear of the van, opens it, and a swa of DOGS pile out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, gang, single file. You know the rules: No pushing, no humping, and no sniffing heinies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the shop opens and Harry's annoyed boss, MR. PALMER, sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why aren't those mutts on leashes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same reason you're not on a leash, sir because it's demeaning and it chafes like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get them in here now! They all have to be bathed and clipped in an hour. Palmer disappears back inside. Harry CALLS to the dogs bu they pay no attention. He struggles to keep them from wandering off. He grabs a couple of SMALL POOCHES and sit them on a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kids stay right here... As he turns to round up the other, we discover that the w isn't a wall it's a flatbed truck. The truck drives away, taking the two dogs with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at truck) Hey, wait a minute! Harry chases after the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd Christmas pulls the limousine into a long, tree-lin driveway. He gets out and looks up in awe at an IMPRESSIV STONE MANSION. He WHISTLES to himself, then walks to the front oor and RINGS THE BELL. The double-front doors of the mansion open and MARY SWANS appears. She's 25 and gorgeous. Lloyd's jaw drops open wh he lays eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (beat) I'll be just a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mary steps back inside, Lloyd takes out a tiny can of Binaca. He sprays his mouth, under his arms, his hair, be his ears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is driving and Mary is in the back, looking out the window, lost in thought. She's got a BRIEFCASE resting on her lap and she fingers the leather nervously. Lloyd keep glancing at her in the rear-view mirror, but for a moment is speechless. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you going to the airport? Flying somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead-pan) How'd you guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I saw your luggage, then when I noticed the airline ticket, I put two and two together. (beat) So where you heading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're gonna love it. I hear California's beautiful this time of year. Mary looks back out the window and Lloyd sneaks another glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Christmas. Lloyd Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mary. ON LLOYD - we can almost see his mind work. He's desperat to impress her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, this isn't my real job, you know. It's only temporary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you see, my friend Harry and I are saving up our money so we can open our own pet store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I got worms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we're gonna call it: I Got Worms. We're gonna specialize in selling worm farms you know, like ant farms. A lot of people don't realize that worms make much better pets than ants. They're quiet, affectionate, they don't bite, and they're super with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't ants quiet, too? Lloyd realizes she has a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... well, sure but they aren't half as affectionate. And if you cut an ant's head off, it won't grow back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And best of all, worm farming is a seventy-five-thousand-dollar-a-year industry. I wouldn't mind having a piece of that pie, if you know what I mean. To her credit, she doesn't. They continue driving. Mary l at her watch and crosses her legs. Lloyd can see that she concerned about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Little tense about the flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Something like that. Lloyd SWIVELS AROUND and STARES over his shoulder at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really nothing to worry about, Mary. Statistically, they say you're more likely to get killed on the way to the airport. You know, like in a head-on crash, or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Lloyd, could please keep your eyes on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking. There's a lot of bad rivers out there. Lloyd turns back to the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is putting the last bags on a cart. He closes the t and turns to Mary. She looks nervous and disconcerted as reaches into her purse. She pulls out a ten-dollar tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. It was my pleasure. For the first time, Mary Swanson offers a slight smile. T makes her more lovely than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Mary. Just get trashed and pass out. You'll be there before you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Lloyd. (beat) And good luck with your worms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she PICKS UP HER BRIEFCASE and walks into the termin followed by a PORTER pushing her bags. Lloyd watches her, ENCHANTED, until she's out of sight. Afterwards, he climbs back into the limo,  LOVESICK. For moment he doesn't even have the energy to  turn the key. just drops his head against the steering  wheel, DEVASTAT There's a TAP on the window. Lloyd looks  up to see a POL OFFICER standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, move it, you're in a red zone. Lloyd starts the limo and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary looks tense as she moves through the throngs of travelers. Her pace is slow, deliberate, and her eyes are focused straight ahead. She passes a row of phone botths and two MEN one dressed an ARMANI SUIT, the other in a PLAID SPORTCOAT watch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna leave the briefcase at the foot of the escalator. You make the pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lloyd pulls his limo slowly away, he glances in the ai window and SEES MARY WALKING ALONG. When she stops at the foot of the escalator, he stops, to She puts down the briefcase and checks her coat pocket fo her ticket. Lloyd's attention is distracted by a HONK. He turns to see a car irectly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to car's driver) Drive around me, you pinhead! When he turns back to watch Mary in the terminal he sees that SHE'S GONE, and she's LEFT HER BRIEFCASE AT THE FOOT THE STAIRS. Lloyd jumps to ATTENTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the car into a HANDICAPPED SPOT and hops out. He starts to run into the terminal, then notices the Police Officer and suddenly goes into a spastic walk, limping an dragging him leg behind him like a palsy victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armani Man nods to the Plaid Sportcoat and he starts approach the briefcase. Just as Plaid Sportcoat is reachi for the handle, LLOYD RUNS BY AND GRABS IT. He CONTINUES THE ESCALATOR three steps at a time. The two men look at each other, dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd runs with the briefcase to the TV monitors that pos the departure times. He looks frantically at the confusio of numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! QUICK CUT of a dejected Lloyd looking out the window as h watches as Mary's airplane taxiing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd comes out with the briefcase, passing the two men, FOLLOW HIM AT A DISTANCE. He starts walking down the side when suddenly he STOPS IN HIS TRACKS. HIS POV - his limo is being towed away    under the super of the Police Officer. He takes off after it, but to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this! I'll lose my job! As Lloyd watches the limo get towed out of site, he runs fingers through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the Mutt Cuts van pull up and park at the curb. A dejected Harry climbs out. At the same time, a taxi pulls and drops off Lloyd. (He's clutching Mary Swanson's briefcase.) Both he and Harry climb the steps of the buil They disappear inside without acknowledging each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE STREET - a black Cadillac pulls and parks. Inside are the Armani suit and the Sportcoat. They are J.P. SHAY and JOSEPH MENTALINO (aka JOE MENTAL).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you figure this guy's working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but we'd better find out... Mental takes some PILLS and starts CHOMPING them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ulcer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd and Harry trudge up the stairs and proceed silently toward the door of their apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd and Harry ENTER and   pass each other quietly as th both plunk down in their   favorite easy chairs. (Lloyd s has the briefcase in his   lap.) Harry's caged parakeet, tweets hello, but the two   guys just sit there SILENTLY. The place is a mess. Wallpaper's peeling off the walls. T carpet is threadbare and filthy. In the corner we see a miniature WORM FARM and a large terrarium filled with dir and worms. Here are a couple pieces of haggard furniture with stuffing spilling out of the gashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got fired again. Lloyd shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be harsh, Harry, but let's face it, you are one pathetic loser. No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None taken. Were you shitcanned, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. (beat) I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a hunch Arnie was gonna fire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you wait and see if your suspicions were well-founded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winners control their own destiny, Har. Lloyd fetches a couple beers from the fridge and throws o to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the thing that really chaps my ass is that I just spent my life savings turning my van into a poodle. (beat) The alarm alone cost me two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal. That car's an old bomb anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? It's only six years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's forty-two in dog years. They open their beers and drink simultaneously. Then Harr notices the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the briefcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a love memento.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most beautiful woman alive. Her name was Mary. I drove her to the airport. Sparks flew, emotions ran high, breasts heaved. She left this case in the terminal and flew to Aspen and out of my life. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO you really expect me to go snooping around in someone else's private property?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) It's locked. They take another sip of their beers. Suddenly we hear a LOUD KNOCK at the door. Petey the parakeet starts to SQUA The guys look at each other, ALARMED, then Harry tip-toes the PEEPHOLE. HARRY'S POV - a DISTORTED-LOOKING J.P. Shay and Joe Menta are standing at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERING to Harry) Friend or foe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have any friends. Harry is still squinting out the peephole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't recognize them. Could be student loan thugs again, or the IRS, or maybe somebody pissed off about that case of Girl Scout cookies you bounced a check on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I ordered Mystic Mint. The little swindlers gave me Peanut Butter Praline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whoever they are, they look serious. One of them's even wearing plaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cringing) That's a hostile pattern. I say we bail and get down to unemployment. Lloyd GRABS THE BRIEFCASE and the two of them EXIT out th window and down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poodle van pulls up to the curb in front of the build and PARKS NEXT TO A FIRE HYDRANT. Lloyd and Harry climb o Lloyd takes a trash can and places it OVER THE HYDRANT, COVERING IT COMPLETELY.

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: STANLEY GRABNER is small, plump, balding, not a lot of la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I'm delighted to say that neither I nor the unemployment epartment of the state of Rhose Island can do anything for you. (beat) You've run out of chances. You're unemployable. Remember last year? Middle of winter I busted my butt to

dialogues.speaker: GET YOU BOTH PRIME JOBS. TWELVE-
dialogues.text: fifty an hour, and you went and blew it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blew it? For your information, we only missed three days in two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and that was because of a blizzard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding)

dialogues.speaker: YOU WERE SNOW PLOW OPERATORS
dialogues.text: Grabner falls back in his chair, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Stan. I'm sure you can find something else for us. How about another crack at that Suicide Hotline? Grabner jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HARRY & LLOYD'S APARTMENT - AFTERNOON J.P. Shay is looking through Harry and Lloyd's kitchen cupboards as Joe Mental comes out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The briefcase ain't here. He must've taken it with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (beat) Well he's gotta come home sometime. Joe Mental ominously approaches Petey the parakeet's cage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should leave him a little message to let 'em know we're playing hardball. Mental opens the cage door and wraps his meaty fist aroun the bird, who SCREECHES IN TERROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a la Tweety Bird) I taut I taw a puddy cat. Mental smiles, and as we PAN to J.P. Shay, we hear a bone chilling O.S. SNAP and Petey the bird stops SQUAWKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still Tweety) I did, I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cuts van pulls up to the curb. A depressed Lloyd and Harry climb out and mope up to their apartment buildi entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me what's left of our dough. I'll go to the corner and buy a few necessities. Harry hands his friend some crumpled bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's cheaper, Thunderbird or Night Train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Robitussin it's a better buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd comes out of the store with his arms full of grocer He stops at a newspaper machine, pulls out his WALLET and removes a quarter. He drops the quarter in the machine, opens it, and realiz that he DOESN'T HAVE A FREE HAND to pick up the newspaper He puts his wallet inside the machine, picks up the newsp and as he does so THE MACHINE SLAMS SHUT WITH HIS WALLET STILL INSIDE. Lloyd SIGHS, puts his grocery bags on the machine, and ch his pockets. NO MORE CHANGE. Just then, an ELDERLY WOMAN struggles by using a WALKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, little old lady, do you have change for a dollar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change? No, I'm sorry, I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well could you do me a favor and guard this while I go break a dollar? My wallet's locked in this machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, young man... Lloyd runs back into the store. We HOLD ON THE STORE DOOR Lloyd EXITS a few seconds later with a handful of quarter Suddenly he stops in his tracks. The ELDERLY LADY, HER WA AND HIS GROCERIES ARE GONE. As he takes a closer look, he sees that SHE HAS TAKEN HIS WALLET ALSO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thoroughly beleaguered Lloyd is trudging empty-handed u the steps to his apartment. INT. LLOYD & HARRY'S APARTMENT The door opens and Lloyd ENTERS. Harry is sitting on the couch, looking almost comatose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the booze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone. I got robbed by Grandma Walton. She got my wallet, too. Harry drops his head and lets out a MOAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man, cheer up. We've been own before. I'm sure we'll land on our heads somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets worse, Lloyd. My parakeet Petey he's... he's dead. Lloyd looks touched by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, I'm sorry, Harry. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head fell off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head fell off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was pretty old. Lloyd puts his hand on Harry's shoulder compassionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) I don't suppose he had a warranty...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I bought him used. As Lloyd thinks about the unfairness of life, he grows up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! I've had it with this ump! We don't have food, we don't have jobs, our pets' heads are falling off, we're surrounded by roving gangs of larcenous old LADIES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I won't calm down. Lloyd flops down in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are we doing here anyway, Harry? We've got to get out of this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and go where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you where: someplace warm, a place where the beer flows like wine, where beautiful women instinctively flock like the salmon of Capistrano. (dramatic PAUSE) I'm talking about Aspen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Aspen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Lloyd, the French are assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something: do you want to end up like Petey dead in some flea-ridden apartment, face- down on a Dear Abby column, with a soggy sunflower seed pressed against your beak? Or do you want to enjoy your life? (beat) Come on, Harry, don't let Petey's eath be in vain. Don't you see what he was saying? Spread your wings, man. he was saying? Spread your wings, man. Fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What are you talking about, Lloyd? His head fell off. (dawning realization) Wait a second, I know what you're up to. You just wanna go to Aspen so you can find that girl who lost her briefcase and you need me to drive you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit. I'll drive. (beat) And what's so wrong about going someplace where we know someone who can plug us into the social pipeline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (torn) I don't know, Lloyd. I think we should stay here, hunt for jobs, and keep saving money for the worm store. I'm getting a little sick and tired of always running from creditors. Lloyd moves to the window and looks out at the gray, wint cityscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm sick and tired of, Harry? I'm sick and tired of having to eek my way through life. I'm sick and tired of being a nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) But most of all, I'm sick and tired of having nobody. There's a deadly SILENCE as they both think about this. T Harry tries to lighten the mood. He opens his arms wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Lloyd. Give us a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other hand, maybe you're right, Harry. Maybe we should stay here and try our luck in bankruptcy court. With all those lawsuits against us, I'm sure we'll win at least one. It could be a boost to our egos. Harry sees that Lloyd has a point. He stands and approach Petey's cage. His eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional) Petey, I made a promise to you once, man... (thinking hard) ...and I'll be damned if I can remember what it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutts van is going down the highway while Danny Wilson's "Mary's Prayer" plays on the soundtrack. The van drives past and we HOLD ON a sign that reads: "YOU ARE LE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS of the car travelling down the road while the song continues to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's behind the wheel and Lloyd's in the passenger sea The Animal's "We've Got to Get Out of This Place" is BLAS on the radio and the guys are SINGING ALONG:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD & HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We've got to get out of this place, If it's the last thing we ever do, We've got to get out of this place, Girl, there's a better life, for me and you..." Lloyd turns down the radio. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're finally doing it. Do you realize that in all the years we've known each other, this is the first time we've done this together. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been run out of town? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken a trip. Harry reaches over and UNDOES HIS SEATBELT. Lloyd watches curious. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do that? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your seatbelt off. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we just cleared the danger zone. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know anything, Lloyd? Ninety percent of all accidents happen within five miles of home. We've already traveled 6.3 miles.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD THINKS ABOUT THIS. THEN
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what about the people who live around here? What if we got into an accident with one of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry considers this, then sheepishly puts his seatbelt b on. Lloyd opens a bag of Doritos and fiddles with the rad HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get those? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bought 'em when we filled up. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd, I thought we agreed to confer on all expenditures. We're on a tight budget, remember? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This didn't come out of our travel fund. I was able to scrape up twenty- five bucks before we left. You know, so we could live in style. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get twenty-five extra bucks? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold some stuff to Billy in 4-C. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the blind kid? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Lloyd looks out the window guiltily. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you sell him, Lloyd? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some odds and ends. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specifically? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a few baseball cards, a sack of marbles, Petey, three comic books a second, are you telling me you sold my dead bird to a blind kid? Well who else was I gonna sell it to? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lloyd, Petey didn't even have a head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your mind at ease, friend. I took care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the stairs leading up to the building is little blind boy, BILLY. He sits in a wheelchair playing with a PARAKEET WHOSE HEAD IS SCOTCH-TAPED ON. He throws ead bird up, but it flops into his lap. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly! Joe Mental and J.P. Shay approach and climb the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A NOTE - taped to Harry and Lloyd's apartment do It reads: TO ALL OUR

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD AND HARRY.
dialogues.text: PULLBACK to reveal Joe Mental and J.P. Shay. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those bastards. They're rubbing it right in our faces. J.P. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Andre will have a goddamn aneurysm if we don't get that briefcase back. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't   worry, we'll get it back. And I'll   tell you something else. They ain't   gonna reach Aspen, either. I'll   make sure of that. Mental takes out more ANTACID PILLS and starts to chew on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pissed-off Shay and Mental EXIT the building. Mental po more antacid pills into his mouth as they descend the sta Little Billy is still tossing the lifeless parakeet into air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, boy, fly! Plop. Then Billy hears Shay and Mental on the steps and C

dialogues.speaker: OUT
dialogues.text: BILLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, mister. Is there something wrong with my bird? Mental picks up the bird, studies it, then angrily and WI IT DOWN THE STREET as hard as he can. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Ironside, he just flew south for the winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is still driving while Lloyd studies a map spread o before him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far have we gone? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to this map, about an inch and a half. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. We're gonna need a smaller map or we'll never get there. We don't have enough gas money. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. We have more than enough. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you're wrong, Lloyd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I believe I'm right, Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still say wrong, Lloyd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you wanna bet? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd looks at his friend, incredulous. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you don't bet? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I don't gamble, you know that. Never have and never will. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, bull. I'll bet you our next meal that I can get you gambling before the day's out. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way, Lloyd. You can't do it. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you three-to-one odds. That's three feedbags if you win, against only one if you lose. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your money, Lloyd. I already told you, I don't gamble. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, five-to-one I can get you gambling before the day's out. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, pal, no way. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it ten-to-one. Harry sticks out his hand. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got yourself a bet, sucker! As Harry SHAKES LLOYD'S HAND, Lloyd breaks into a BIG SMI Harry immediately realizes he's been had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutt van is sandwiched between mountainous tract trailer trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd and Harry are sitting at a booth, surrounded by tab of tough-looking TRUCKERS. Harry oesn't look happy. A mid aged, no-nonsense WAITRESS approaches their table with a couple of burgers and drinks. She puts them down in front the boys and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Waitress)

dialogues.speaker: UH, EXCUSE ME...
dialogues.text: The Waitress reluctantly returns to the table. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the soup du jour? WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the soup-of-the-day. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds tasty. I'll have a bowl. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Anything else before I leave the area? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, this chocolate milk isn't mixed very well. Could you please bring me a spoon? The Waitress SIGHS and picks up the milk. Then she BLOWS

dialogues.speaker: THE DRINK.
dialogues.text: WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Now you don't need one. The guys watch her stomp away.

dialogues.speaker: FEELS GOOD TO MINGLE WITH THESE LAID-
dialogues.text: back country-folk, don't it, Harry? Harry wipes off his straw with a napkin. As he moves to p it in the ashtray, he accidentally KNOCKS OVER THE SALT SHAKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spilled the salt. That's bad luck. We're driving across the country and the last thing we need is bad luck. Quick, toss a handful of salt over your right shoulder. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's good luck. Harry shrugs, shakes some salt into his palm, and flings over his shoulder. Suddenly they hear a YELP. MALE VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) What the fuck?! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or was it the left shoulder? They turn and see a burly TRUCKER wiping salt out of his eyes. TRUCKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the dead man threw shit in my eye? The huge Trucker stands and squints at Lloyd and Harry. H wearing a FOAM BASEBALL CAP that says: WINE 'EM, DINE 'EM SIXTY-NINE 'EM. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a terrible accident, Sir. Believe me, I would never do anything to offend a man of your size. Please accept my most sincere apology. The Trucker GROWLS and approaches the table, egged on by equally burly FRIENDS. BURLY FRIEND #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teach him a lesson, Sea Bass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sea Bass glares down at Harry's hamburger. SEA BASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna eat that? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... the thought had crossed my mind. At this, Sea Bass leans over and DROPS A BIG, BROWN WAD O

dialogues.speaker: THE HAMBURGER.
dialogues.text: SEA BASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still want it? Harry stares at the burger non-commitally. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, you go ahead. Sea Bass picks up the burger and walks back to his table, the LAUGHTER of his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.P. Shay is at the gas pump filling the black Cadillac w Joe Mental stretches his legs. A large truck pulls away, REVEALING THE PREVIOUSLY HIDDEN MUTT CUTTS VAN. Mental sm at this, and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress drops the check on Lloyd and Harry's table a STOMPS away. Harry studies the bill and SIGHS. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. I'm out eight bucks and I still haven't eaten. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you'd stop picking fights with the locals... (brightening) Wait a second. I think I just had an idea. Follow me... Lloyd stands and walks over to Sea Bass and his pals. A nervous Harry trails after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentlemen, I'd just like to apologize for that unpleasant scene a little earlier. SEA BASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm trying to say is, my friend and I would like to buy you guys a round of beers, just to bury the hatchet. Harry stares at Lloyd like he's out of his mind, but the Truckers seem to like the idea. SEA BASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it four boiler-makers. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want, sir. I'll have the waitress send them over. Oh, and fellas hope to see you again down the road. Lloyd and Harry move away from the table toward the CASHI HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd, what are you doing? You know we can't afford to buy them drinks. Lloyd hands the Cashier their check. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Sea Bass and the fellas offered to pick up our check. They said just add this to their tab. CASHIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Sea Bass said that? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if that guy at the table over there is Sea Bass... He points across the room to Sea Bass and company. Sea Ba

dialogues.speaker: NODS TO THE CASHIER AND GESTURES TO HIS TABLE, NOT WANTIN
dialogues.text: TO MISS OUT ON HIS FREE DRINK. The Cashier is convinced. CASHIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey-dokey, if that's what he wants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry smiles at this. He grabs a couple Beef Jerky's, a c bar, and a copy of The National Enquirer off the counter. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and put these on there, too. CASHIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cashier) By the way, how far is it to Rhode Island from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door BURSTS OPEN and a red-faced Sea Bass STORM OUT, followed by his buddies, the Cashier, and the Waitre SEA BASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill those sons-of-bitches! CASHIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry and you'll catch 'em. They was on their way to Rhode Island. The Truckers jump in their rigs and RUMBLE AWAY   in the OPPOSITE DIRECTION our boys are headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutts van breezes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jubilant Harry's driving and chewing on a mouthful of B Jerky. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish we could've seen Sea Bass's face when he got the bill. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope we never have to. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. That fish-head is probably half-way to Providence by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. Harry checks his rear-view mirror nervously. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, stop the car. I gotta take a whiz. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? I'm not stopping now. What if they figure out we went the other way. They'll be on us in no time. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gotta go. What am I supposed to do? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold it. I'm about to explode. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... just take a whiz in an empty beer bottle. There's a couple on the floor in the back seat. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm serious. I'm not stopping now. We could get killed. Lloyd SIGHS. He takes an EMPTY BEER BOTTLE from the back seat and UNZIPS his fly. Suddenly we hear a PEEING SOUND. Then: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottle's almost full and I'm still going. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well stop going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop once I already started, you know that. Quick, get me another bottle. Harry can BARELY HOLD THE STEERING WHEEL as he reaches wa in the back seat for an empty. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, be careful! You almost went off the road. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Lloyd. I'm doing the best I can. He hands Lloyd another empty and Lloyd quickly makes the switch. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, hold this. Before Harry knows it he's holding the full BOTTLE OF URI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Mutt Cutts van travels down the highway, it passes STATE TROOPER on a motorcycle hidden in the bushes. The Trooper takes off after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is doing his best to steer while now holding FIVE F BOTTLES AND Lloyd is still going at it in the passenger s HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, a goddamn camel? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I haven't gone all day. Just then they hear a LOUDSPEAKER: STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Pull over! They turn to see the POLICE MOTORCYCLE cruising right bes then. Harry rolls down his window and CALLS OUT: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: PULL OVER
dialogues.text: Harry glances down at his sweater he's wearing, then back the Trooper. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) No, it's a Cardigan! But thanks for noticing! He rolls his window back up and turns to an equally baffl Lloyd. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what is this, the fashion police? The Cop turns on his SIREN. STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STATE TROOPER is walking up beside the stopped Mutt C van, staring at it with isapproval. STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: License and registration, please. Harry hands him the papers. STATE TROOPER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you fellas were all over the road back there. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, we had a little... ifficulty in the car. STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. (beat) Have you boys been doing a little rinking maybe? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's that? He points to the OPEN, FULL BEER BOTTLES hidden in the se between them. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nothing, sir. STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know it's against the law to rive with an open alcohol container in this state? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, your honor, he's telling the truth. It's not beer. The officer smirks. STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? The Trooper reaches in and picks up one of the bottles. H inspects the beer label, then MOVES THE BOTTLE TO HIS LIPS. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I wouldn't TROOPER --You'd keep your mouth shut if you knew what was good for you. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath) YOU WOULD, TOO... Harry shoots Lloyd a look as the Trooper begins GULPING d the piss. He pauses uncertainly and a SICK LOOK COMES OVE HIS FACE. He takes a DEEP BREATH. Then: STATE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained) Get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutts van is pulling back onto the highway while the officer remains in the breakdown lane with his hands his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is making steady progress through the dark night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is driving now while Harry sleeps in the passenger seat. The song, "Cut Flowers" by The Smithereens, starts play as Lloyd FANTASIZES about his future in Aspen.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD'S FANTASY
dialogues.text: Lloyd is walking up the steps of a luxurious, snow-covere chalet, carrying Mary's briefcase. The sky is absurdly bl and children are making a snowman on the lawn. It's all o of a dream world. He KNOCKS on the door, tentatively. Mar opens it. She looks at him, then at the briefcase, and br into the BIGGEST, SWEETEST SMILE he's ever seen. Then she slowly backs into the house, gesturing for him to follow. Lloyd follows Mary down a hallway. As he trails after her she pulls off her shirt, revealing her bare back, and gla over her shoulder at him. CAMERA MOVES around a corner and now we're in a STEAMY BATHROOM. The shower is running and we see the silhouette two people behind the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: OOH... OOH... MARY...
dialogues.text: MARY (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does that feel, Lloyd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON LLOYD - we see he's taking the TEGRIN CHALLENGE, with different shampoos on either side of his head and a noticeable part down the middle. MARY (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the other side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nothing at all. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Lloyd, will you wash my nipples...? ON MARY - her   hair is slicked back, making her look bet than ever. As   the CAMERA PANS DOWN toward her breasts, are surprised   to see not breasts but a SET OF HEADLIGHT SUPERIMPOSED   OVER HER CHEST AREA. The headlights FLASH Then TWICE. ON LLOYD - he blinks, confused at what's happening. JUMP CUT   TO - an eighteen-wheeler is ROARING RIGHT TOWA THE MUTT   CUTTS VAN on the highway. Lloyd quickly veers into his   lane and avoids tragedy by a whisker. A shaken lets out   a SIGH OF RELIEF, and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutts van is parked outside this seedy establish A neon sign blinks: GROUP DISCOUNTS - HAVE YOUR NEXT AFFAIR HERE. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v.o.) I don't know, Lloyd, I feel a little sleazy staying here when we're not even engaged. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v.o.) Hey, it's the only motel that charges by the hour. We can't afford anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd and Harry are sitting in a large, HEART-SHAPED JACU Lloyd is sipping a beer and Harry is absorbed in the Enqu as the water swirls around them. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, this sure is the life. Cold beer, a hot tube, and fuzzy pink sheets... You know, there's only one thing that could make this moment any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had a nice set of knockers. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two things, Lloyd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now I'd settle for one. Lloyd takes a swig of beer. Harry puts down the paper and looks around at the romantic decor. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Lloyd, these places just don't do it for me. Brings back too many memories. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Harry? Some little filly break your heart? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it was a girl. Fraida Felcher. We stayed at a place like this once No-Tell Motel out on Route 31. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felcher? You mean the babe who worked for the tractor company? Harry nods. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same. We had this incredibly romantic time. Boy, I thought we'd be together forever. (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then about a week later, right out of the blue, she sends me a John Deere letter. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cold, Har. Give you any reason? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called her up and she gave me some crap about me not listening to her enough or something like that. I wasn't really paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry reaches for a beer and busts it open. He takes a bi gulp. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing that really hurts is I think she was seeing another guy. Never id find out who. ON LLOYD - he does his best to hide his GUILT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that the black Cadillac is   parked a few cars ove from the Mutt Cutts van with J.P.   Shay in the passenger PAN OVER to a payphone. Inside is   Joe Mental. Outside t booth, an ANXIOUS MAN impatiently   paces back and forth waits for the phone. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) The boys are holed-up in a little love nest for the night. I think they're a couple of fucking weirdos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICHOLAS ANDRE is pacing around the room with a cordless phone. He's in his late 30s, wears a ponytail, and dresse in Aspen/Rodeo Drive chic. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in hell are those guys up to? Is it possible that they're Feds?

dialogues.speaker: CONVERSATION
dialogues.text: MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlikely from what I've seen. The ANXIOUS MAN taps on the phone booth and motions for M to hang up. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this one goddamn bit, Mental. You and Shay were supposed to grab that bag so we could end this shit. Now I don't know what the hell's going on. Andre SIGHS and wipes some perspiration from his upper li The Anxious Man KNOCKS on the booth again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second, Mr. Andre... Mental puts the phone down and motions the    Anxious Man to the booth. The Man moves forward a few    inches. Ment motions him even closer. When he's about a    foot away, punches his hand through the glass of the    booth and kn the Anxious Man out cold. Then Mental picks up the phone again. MENTAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, boss. You were saying...? ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mental, just find out what they're up to. I want to know who these guys are. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'm on it. Mental hangs up the phone, looks around to make sure he's not being watched, then approaches the parked Mutt Cutt v He's joined by J.P. Shay. As they get within five feet of the vehicle, we hear a LO GROWL. They stop in their tracks and turn, expecting to s a dog but there isn't one. They both take another step forward, and the GROWL GETS LOUDER AND MEANER. Again, Men and Shay stop. He peeks under the car. Nothing. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck...? Finally, Shay reaches for the door handle. As soon as he touches it, though, the car alarm goes off but instead of siren, it's the incredibly annoying sound of a POODLE YAP Mental jumps back and pulls his gun. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the goddamn dog? Shay shrugs, nervous. The YAPPING grows EVEN LOUDER now, forcing a flustered Shay and Mental to retreat from the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING SHOT of a luxurious mountainside home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agitated Mary Swanson (the young woman who lost her briefcase) is pacing back and forth in

dialogues.speaker: ARE HER FATHER KARL AND HIS MUCH-
dialogues.text: younger second wife, HELEN. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just doesn't make any sense. I left the money exactly where they instructed me to. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it makes a great deal of sense, Mary. We should have called in the authorities the moment we knew Melvin had been kidnapped. KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Helen, we've been through this already for Christ's sake, Karl, these bastards will extort us into bankruptcy if we let them. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'd never forgive myself if something happened to Melvin. KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop upsetting my daughter, Helen. She's been through quite enough already. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not her fault, Daddy. We're all a little on edge. Just then the living room door opens and the pony tailed Nicholas Andre ENTERS. He looks appropriately solemn. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has there been any word, Mr. Swanson? KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet, Nicholas. Andre looks upset. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I should call off the Preservation benefit this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: IT WOULD BE EASY ENOUGH TO RE-
dialogues.text: schedule. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Nicholas, it's imperative that we carry on as usual. The atmosphere in the room couldn't be more somber. Karl Swanson holds his hand out to his aughter. KARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, sweetheart. I'll do everything they ask. Nothing's going to happen to Melvin, I promise you. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Daddy. Karl Swanson looks out the window, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black Cadillac pulls over to the side of the road. Jo Mental gets out of the car and props the hood open. He ta out his gun, SLIDES IN A NEW CLIP, and puts it back in hi pocket. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shay) Lie down on the front seat. After they pick me up I want you to follow us. Then he folds his arms and the two killers wait for the v to come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd taps Harry's shoulder. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. Harry taps Lloyd back. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. Lloyd immediately taps Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. Quitsies. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping him back) Anti-quitsies. You're it. Quitsies. No anti-quitsies. No startsies. Lloyd shakes his head, defeated. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you're good, Harry. (beat) Hey, didn't I tell you this trip would be a blast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Mental squints down the road, sees the Mutt Cutts van approaching, and starts WAVING HIS HANDS to flag them dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield we can see Mental waving. The guys don't slow down, through. The just WAVE BACK as they BLOW RIGHT BY HIM. Harry also toots the horn, which makes the SOUND OF A DOG BARKING. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I told you these country folks were friendly, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an angry Mental watches them disappear down the road, Shay sits up in the front seat. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These fuckers are really pissing me off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear The Zombie's 'Time of the Season' as the van flas by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refresh my memory on something, Lloyd: what exactly do we do when we get to Aspen? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the first thing we do is take a good deep breath of that famous Aspenese air. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh, huh? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freshest. They say on any day of the week you can smell a moose-fart ten miles away. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere) Wow... talk about paradise. (beat) And after we're finished breathing, what next, Lloyd? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we make a splash on the social scene. Just then, Lloyd notices something up the road. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, look the golden arches. Pull over, I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutt car is at the drive-through window. MCDONALD'S EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That's two cheese burgers, two fries, and two medium Cokes. Five seventy- two. Harry hands a ten-dollar-bill to the Employee, who return handful of change. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, before he can  give them   the bag of food, the guy absentmindedly DRIVE  OFF. As   they pull out of the park lot, the McDonald's  Employee   sticks his head out the w and WAVES THE BAG OF  FOOD at   them. MCDONALD'S EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! But the guys are already around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutt van is on the road again, cruising along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About this social scene how do you expect a couple mutts like us to make a splash in the land of pedigrees when we don't even have any money? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, once we drop the briefcase off to Mary, she'll be so grateful she'll plug us right into the party circuit. After that, we do a little of the ski

dialogues.speaker: SCENE, HOB-NOB WITH THE ELBOW-
dialogues.text: rubbers, and walk out of there in the spring with enough business connections to open a first-class worm operation You see, you don't get rich working, Harry. You get rich knowing the rich. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you hear that? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some bum down at unemployment. Harry thinks about this. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Lloyd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money does terrible things to people. I mean, we could lose our friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd thinks about this. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? So? Harry nods and looks out the window. Suddenly SOMETHING D ON LLOYD. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a second. Hold everything. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you forgetting something? Harry thinks about this. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at Mickey D's? A little matter you might've overlooked...? Harry wracks his brain, but to no avail. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Lloyd rolls his eyes. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My change. As a sheepish Harry gives Lloyd his change, they notice something up ahead. HARRY & LLOYD'S POV - ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD, JOE ME

dialogues.speaker: WAVING THEM
dialogues.text: DOWN AGAIN. This time the Cadillac is PARKED SIDEWAYS ACR

dialogues.speaker: BLOCKING THEIR PATH.
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this guy's in trouble. Why on't you pull over. Lloyd looks at Harry. Harry remembers that he's driving. pulls the car to the side of the road. Mental approaches passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys going as far as Des Moines? My car died and I'm late for a business meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back on the highway and Joe Mental is SITTING BET THEM, looking extremely ANNOYED. The guys are in the midd of an argument. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fruit. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a vegetable. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's a fruit. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I happen to know it's a vegetable. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, why don't we leet an impartial judge decide. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine with me. Harry turns to Joe Mental. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Mentalino, settle our bet: Are jelly beans fruits or vegetables? Mental grits his teeth as he pops a few antacid pills in mouth. He reaches into his coat pocket and we see a GLINT STEEL. Just when he's about to pull the gun out, though, Lloyd hits the breaks and SKIDS to a stop beside a bunch hitchhiking MIGRANT WORKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio have picked up SIX MIGRANT WORKERS and everyone crammed into the car including a CRYING BABY who sits on pissed-off Mental's lap. Someone's playing a FLAMENCO GUI and the gang is SINGING a SPANISH SONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Migrant Family is gone now. Harry and Lloyd are playi a game while Mental stares straight ahead, furious. His e are watering and he looks ill. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Harry, my turn. Let 'er rip. Harry lifts a cheer and lets out a LOUD FART. Lloyd SNIFF few times, then closes his eyes and WAFTS it up toward hi nostrils, as if it was the aroma of a fine wine. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... full-bodied, delicate bouquet, aged to perfection will rip no fart before it's time. (beat) Come on, Marquis of Dingleberry's rules: you got ten seconds. All right. I'll say: cheese doodles, chili dog extra onions, garden salad with blue... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit-Kat bar. Harry throws up his arms, defeated. He hands Lloyd a buck HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best, man. (beat) Okay, my turn. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your manners, Harry? We have a guest. Harry punches Mental's shoulder playfully. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mr. Mentalino. Let one fly. It's only a buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large neon road sign beside the cafГ© shows a man's exasperated face with FLAMES SHOOTING FROM HIS NOSE, MOUT AND EARS. The sign advertises: HOTTEST CHILI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd and Harry are sitting at a table with a hateful Joe Mental. The boys are each holding up a POINTED RED CHILI PEPPER. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do one if you will. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you go first. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you go first. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you go first. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you both stop being a couple of pussies and go at the same time. It ain't that hot. Lloyd and Harry exchange a look, then simultaneously BITE INTO THE PEPPERS. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm, not bad... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, more tingly than hot. Suddenly the boys' EYES LIGHT UP. THEY LET OUT A SHRIEK. smile begins to curl on Mental's lips. He pours them a co glasses of water from a pitcher. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have some water. It'll help. Lloyd and Harry who are both sweating profusely now start to GULP down their water. This, of course, makes it burn more. MENTAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, shucks, that's right. Water just makes it worse... The boys run to the bar and DUMP PITCHERS OF WATER ON THE HEADS, much to the elight of a CHUCKLING Joe Mental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mental is on the phone outside the front door TALKING to Nicholas Andre.

dialogues.speaker: CONVERSATION
dialogues.text: MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mental. I'm just sitting down to a nice meal with our boys. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work. What did you find out so far? MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet, but I'm gonna shake 'em own for information at lunch. (beat) Then I'm gonna kill 'em for dessert. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well eat fast, time's running out. And whatever you do, don't let them get any closer. I don need them here running around Aspen. Mental pulls a BLACK VIAL OF PILLS out of his jacket. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, they ain't gonna be running around anywhere after I dump a little cyanide in their pops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the table, the boys are soaked and HUFFING as if they just finished the Boston Marathon. The burgers have been served, but Lloyd and Harry are still too traumatize to touch them. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That really wasn't very polite of him, was it? Maybe we should loosen the screws of his chair. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Dunne, I'm surprised at you. Perhaps it's about time you brushed

dialogues.speaker: UP ON A LITTLE TOME THAT WE GOD-
dialogues.text: fearing adults call the Bible. It's crammed with all kind of pithy rules to live your life by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humbled) You mean like 'turn the other cheek?' LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean like 'an eye for an eye.' Hand me those peppers the atomic ones. Harry passes the jar and the two of them LOAD JOE MENTAL'

dialogues.speaker: PEPPERS, EXPERTLY CAMOUFLAGING THEM WITH LETTUCE.
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Here he comes. Lloyd and Harry bite into their food as Joe Mental sits b down at the table. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling any better, boys? As he pours ketchup on his burger, the guys glance at eac other and TITTER. Then he picks it up and brings it to hi mouth. Just before biting into it, though, he PAUSES. MENTAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, why you fellas headed to Aspen? Vacation? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like re-location. Mental starts toward the burger but stops again. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like you packed much. All I saw was a couple bags... and that briefcase. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The briefcase isn't even ours. Some lady just left it at the airport. We're bringing it back to her. This is news to Mental. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you don't even know her? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I was just her limo river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mental looks at the two of them and realizes that they're serious. Then he BREAKS OUT LAUGHING. MENTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about being in the wrong place at the wrong time... Lloyd and Harry share a     confused look. Mental shakes head and BITES INTO HIS     BURGER, CHEWING HEARTILY. Alm immediately, his happy     demeanor is replaced by a LOOK HORROR. His FACE TURNS     RED, HE GRABS HIS STOMACH AND

dialogues.speaker: GROUND, GASPING.
dialogues.text: The boys look at each other guiltily, then bend down to h him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you okay, man? It was just a goof. MENTAL (STRAINED WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ulcer... quick... pills... in my coat... Harry checks Mental's coat pocket        for his antacid unwittingly brings out the BLACK        OF CYANIDE PILLS. some pills out and hands them to        Mental, who tosse his mouth and starts to MUNCH on        them. For a moment, he appears to improve. His BREATHING SLOWS he sits up. Then his EYES LIGHT UP. MENTAL'S POV - QUICK ZOOM IN on the black bottle Harry is holding! MENTAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch! Mental GURGLES and keels over, DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd and Harry are back on the road, looking solemn. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is a fragile thing, Har. One minute you're chewing on a burger; the next minute you're dead meat. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he blamed me. You heard him. Those were his last words. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't count that gurgling sound. Harry lets out a GROAN. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, relax, man, I'm just as responsible as you are we both slipped him the peppers and look at me, I on't feel guilty at all. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small comfort coming from a man who sells dead birds to blind kids. (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it, Lloyd. I've got a ead guy pissed at me. His restless spirit will probably haunt me for the next seventy-five years. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous. You probably won't live to see forty. Harry perks up, cheered by this thought. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. (beat) Wow. What a relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Mutt Cutts van flashes by on it's westward journey we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR is covering up the body of Joe Mental as he TALK to DETECTIVE DALE. The etective is a no-nonsense type in mid-forties with a military-regulation crewcut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My official conclusion is that the eceased expired from oxygen eprivation caused by the presence of cyanide in the bloodstream. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he was poisoned? DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unquestionably. We found these by the body. He holds up the container of cyanide pills. Dt. Dale nods and approaches another COP in the b.g. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waitress says he was with a couple of younger guys. They're the ones who called the ambulance then they hit the road. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea where they were going? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A witness at the next table thought he heard them say they were driving to France. Dale frowns at this and the Cop shrugs. COP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a report they were seen heading west on I-80 toward Colorado. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a make on the vehicle? The Cop consults his note pad. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. They were driving an '84 poodle. Dt. Dale does a double-take. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An '84 what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straight-faced) Well it might have been a wire-haired terrier, Detective. They're very similar in appearance. The Detective looks confused, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are extremely exhausted as they plow through the black night toward Aspen. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get off and crash at a motel before I crash into one. (yawning) I need a crib fast. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Har. We're gonna have to hold out. Seems we misjudged our expense allocation. If we pay for a motel we won't have enough for gas. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the dough? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We over-leveraged. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sprung for Mr. Chili Pepper's last meal. Felt it was the least we could o after we deep-sixed him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second one burger put us over budget? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slob ordered a double-bacon eluxe and a chocolate malt. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) So what are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive. We've only got ten more hours. We can take turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frightened J.P. Shay is TALKING on the phone with Nicho Andre. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, he's dead. The bastards killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre nervously lights a cigarette as he speaks. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... Andre's forehead begins to glisten with perspiration. ANDRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I want you back here now. If they're coming this way I'm going to need you. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v.o.) How's our bankroll doing? Giving you a hard time? ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin's not the problem. It's these two other guys that have me worried. I wish I knew what the hell they wanted. Andre hangs up the phone and then disappears down his bas stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has a dirt floor. There's a stone WELL in the mi We hear MUFFLED HUMAN WHIMPERING coming from deep within well. Andre walks to the edge of the dark hole. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing today, Melvin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre takes a hit off his cigarette and flicks it into th well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutts van cruises down the lonely interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is now FAST ASLEEP in the passenger seat as Harry d on. A roadsign reading DENVER - 602 MILES whizzes by. Tod Rundgren's "Too Far Gone" begins to play while Harry peer at the empty highway INTROSPECTIVELY. As the song plays w see a series of quick shots: A new sign says DENVER - 421 MILES. Lloyd is still asleep with his feet now on Harry's lap. Another sign reads DENVER - 201 MILES. Harry stares strai ahead, practically catatonic. Lloyd's feet are out the wi and his head is on Harry's lap. The next roadsign says DENVER - 157 MILES. Lloyd's feet a now up over the headrest and his head is down where his f should be. Harry looks on the verge of blacking out. Finally, a sign reads COLORADO STATE LINE - 25 MILES/FOOD GAS NEXT EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutts van pulls up to a gas pump. In the backgro are several tractor-trailer rigs and a cafГ©. Harry climb out, thoroughly exhausted, walks around and opens the passenger door. Lloyd tumbles to the asphalt, STILL ASLEEP. Harry nudges with his foot. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, wake up. You pay, I'll pump. Lloyd comes to and grudgingly pulls himself up to his fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves to the back of the poodle van. He has to LIFT ONE OF THE CAR'S REAR LEGS to unscrew the gas cap. Then h sticks the nozzle in and starts to fill her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd comes around the   corner, dragging a BATHROOM KEY ATTACHED BY A CHAIN TO   A CAR ENGINE toward the Men's Ro When he gets it to the   door, he struggles to lift the e on it's side, finally   managing to slip the key into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is yawning as he pumps the gas. Suddenly a Jeep Che pulls up and a long-legged, tanned, ATHLETIC BEAUTY climb out. This seems to wake Harry up. The Athletic Beauty   smiles at Harry as she grabs a pump starts to fill her   jeep. Harry makes a feeble attempt t brush his hair into   place, then CLEARS HIS THROAT and n to the skis on her   roof-rack. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skis, huh? ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. She continues to pump gas. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They yours? ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of 'em? ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: like a BIG DOG IS PISSING ON HIS LEG. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, you're spraying everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry turns to see the gas GUSHING ALL OVER HIS SHOES. He immediately removes the nozzle and replaces it on the pum as she smiles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is standing in a stall urinating. He starts to read the graffiti scrawled on the wall. Finally, he comes to o that says: FOR A GOOD TIME, MEET ME HERE NOVEMBER 8, 1993 2:15 A.M. SHARP. He frowns at this, then looks nervously at his watch. CLOSE UP OF DIAL - the date reads NOVEMBER 8. ZOOM IN on the minute hand as it CLICKS TO EXACTLY 2:15. Just as a concerned look crosses Lloyd's face, we hear th BATHROOM DOOR SQUEAK OPEN AND SLAM SHUT! Terrified, Lloyd quickly locks the stall door, then crouches on the toilet bowl so his feet aren't visible. The sound of HEAVY FOOTS approaches the stall and then stops. Lloyd looks down to a pair of SIZE 16 WORKBOOTS beneath the door. We can bare hear a LOW GROWL. Then the stall handle JIGGLES. Lloyd ho his breath. The ominous boots MOVE AWAY and Lloyd lets ou SIGH OF RELIEF. All of a sudden the DOOR IS KICKED IN, AND A TOWERING FIG STEPS INTO FRAME. Lloyd looks up and GASPS. HIS POV - it's the Redneck trucker, Sea Bass. SEA BASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, well, if it ain't my old friend. (checks watch) And right on time... As Sea Bass STEPS INTO THE STALL, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Athletic Beauty is back in her Jeep now and Harry has sidled up to the driver's side. He leans against her side view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY
