dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: suitcases in back seat) That's a lot of luggage for a little vacation. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm moving to Aspen. I've got to get away from my boyfriend. He's such a klutz. My astrologer told me I should avoid accident-prone guys. Just then, the side-view mirror Harry has been leaning on

dialogues.speaker: QUICKLY LEAPS TO HIS FEET AS IF NOTHING HAPPENED.
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out mirror) Here, this is a little loose. She throws the mirror into the back seat and takes out a cigarette. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me... He pulls out a match and lights it with a debonair flouri The Athletic Beauty nods her thanks. Harry tosses the mat to the ground, and we hear an O.S. WHOOSH! Wisps of smoke rise around him and we hear the LOW CRACKLE OF SOMETHING BURNING. (Neither of them notice this.) HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, um, maybe when I get to Aspen we can meet up... you know, for hot chocolate or something. She looks him over and smiles. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? You seem pretty harmless. I'll give you my number. Just let me find a pen. As she starts to rummage through her purse, Harry SMELLS SMOKE. He looks down and sees that his RIGHT SHOE IS ABLA He shakes it, then tries to put it out with the other sho but to no avail. Meanwhile, the Athletic Beauty is still searching for a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I have one here somewhere... Harry starts doing a soft-shoe dance to extinguish the fl This only helps to fan them. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) Look, why don't you just tell it to me, I've got a good memory. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you won't forget? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Positive please hurry. He begins hopping around violently. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong? Harry shakes his head no as he bites his lip to keep from screaming. ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, my number is 652-2553. (beat) Oh, wait a second, that's my old number. It's so funny how your mind god sakes, give me the damn number! She's taken aback by this outburst. ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, if you're gonna get pushy you can just forget it! She throws the car into drive and PEELS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sea Bass has his meaty paw wrapped around Lloyd's neck as slides him up the wall of the toilet stall. SEA BASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I'm gonna rape you, then I'm gonna kill you. Any last request? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah could you do it the other way around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sea Bass pushes Lloyd to his knees. Then the trucker step back and UNDOES HIS FLY. The sound of the zipper brings a green color to Lloyd's face. ON THE MEN'S ROOM DOOR - it bursts open and a FLAME-FOOTE Harry rushes into the bathroom, panic-stricken. In his desperation he PLOWS THROUGH THE STALL DOOR KNOCKING SEA BASS ON THE HEAD and thrusts his flaming foot into the toilet, EXTINGUISHING THE FIRE. Harry breathes a DEEP SIGH of relief. Only then does he n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry has to do a DOUBLE-TAKE for this to sink in. Then h lets out an admonishing WHISTLE. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got some serious explaining to o, young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP - of Harry's BURNT SHOE     with the toes sticki on the accelerator. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Harry, I told you what happened, now drop it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, Lloyd. I promise not to mention another word about you being in a bathroom stall with a six-foot, five-inch trucker with his pants own. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a low blow, man. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at that height it's not. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, bud, if you're trying to imply that I'm that thought look, we're almost in Colorado.

dialogues.speaker: COLORADO STATE LINE
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's about   time we pull over and change seats.   I've been driving for nine straight   hours I  don't have the energy to   start a new state. Lloyd nods, and as he pulls off the exit, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SIGN - it reads WELCOME  TO COLORADO, HOME OF ROCKY MOUNTAINS. PAN DOWN to reveal  a number of POLICEME stopping and checking cars as they  cross the border. A HELICOPTER lands on the side of the  road and Detective D hops out. He hurries to the COP in  charge. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of them yet? COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but we're expecting them shortly. A motorist said he spotted a pooch about thirty miles back headed this way. Detective Dale nods, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING SHOT of a mini mart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Lloyd gets in carrying a bag of Dorito and a soda. He settles into the driver's seat and pulls a Beef Jerky out of his back pocket. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I picked you up a Beef Jerky... When he gets no response, he notices that Harry is alread fast asleep in the passenger seat. Lloyd shakes his head. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, some guys just weren't cut out for life on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd starts the engine and    pulls out of the parking l the nearby freeway entrance.    As he enters the on-ramp, ZOOM IN on a sign that says:    ROUTE 80 - EAST. He's unw headed BACK IN THE DIRECTION    THEY JUST CAME FROM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bright daylight now. Harry is sleeping peacefully in the passenger seat while Lloyd sips a coffee. The van hit bump which causes Harry's eyes to flutter open. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Sleepy Head, welcome back. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) How long have I been out? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say a good five hours, anyway. Harry yawns and stretches. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. We must be getting real close, huh? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be. I've been averaging about ninety miles an hour all night. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I'll tell you, this is one angerous highway. You wouldn't believe all the road pizza two dead ogs, a couple of rabbits, a snake and some big thing I couldn't even recognize. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awful. Did you see them get hit or were they already lying there? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit 'em. Harry rubs his eyes and looks at the passing FLATLANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. I expected the Rocky Mountains to be a little rockier than this. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking the same thing. That John Denver's some full of shit, huh? They both stare out the window. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must say, Des Moines sure is a pretty little town. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it really is. (beat) Wait a minute when did you visit Des Moines? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night. We drove through it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You were snoring like a baby when we went through Des Moines. Lloyd shakes his head in amusement, then SNAPS HIS FINGER in Harry's face. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sing-song) Hello? Hello? Anybody home? Rise and shine. (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the one who was asleep, numbskull. Here, take a sip of coffee. You're delirious. A confused Harry sips the coffee and checks out the passi terrain. Then something starts to awn on him. Slowly. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Lloyd, refresh my memory: Doesn't the sun rise in the east and set in the west? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our country it does, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then perchance you can explain to me why the sun is in our face at 7:30 in the morning when we're heading west. Lloyd thinks about this and then looks SICKENED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutt Cutts van is parked next to a couple rigs and Ha is sitting beside it on the pavement, a BROKEN man. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only human, Harry. Anybody can make a mistake. But Harry just sits there, practically catatonic. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man, pull yourself together. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I got half a mind to just jump on the bus to Europe and say goodbye to your ugly mug forever. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) You can't take a bus to Europe, dodo. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Why not? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a passport. Harry lets out a defeated SIGH. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, stop being a baby about this. Okay, so we back-tracked a tad. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tad? Lloyd, you drove almost a sixth of the way across the country in the wrong direction. Now we don't have enough money to get to Aspen, we on't have enough money to get home, we don't have enough to eat, we don't have enough to sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it doesn't do any good having you sitting there on your butt whining about it. If we're gonna get out of this hole, we're gonna have to dig ourselves out. Harry thinks about this. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're absolutely right, Lloyd. He stands up, brushes off his pants, and starts to walk t the highway. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home. I'm walking home. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be serious. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Why not? We're probably only five miles away. Harry starts resolutely toward the road while Lloyd watch LLOYD (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, Mr. Perfect. Like you never screwed up. Harry suddenly STOPS IN HIS TRACKS and turns back to his friend. He seems completely rained. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man... I'm sorry. (beat) I never should have let you talk me into this in the first place. You've got a good reason to goo a beautiful girl's waiting for you. But let's face it, Lloyd, there's nothing waiting for me in Aspen. (beat) There's nothing waiting for me anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd just stands there, SPEECHLESS, as Harry turns and w away. Out of frustration, he BANGS the snout of the car, causing it to BARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is walking down the highway, his thumb stuck out unenthusiastically. A few cars WHIZ by, the cold wind whi at his clothes. A station wagon blows by and throws a BAG  OF GARBAGE out window. It lands at Harry's feet. EXTREME  CLOSE-UP OF HA FACE - a TEAR slowly rolls down his cheek  (like the Indi in the commercial). PAN DOWN to the bag of  garbage. We s it's a BAG OF ONIONS that's ripped open. Suddenly a HEARSE pulls up and stops. It's an ominous-loo vehicle and Harry hesitates. Then the passenger window ro down, revealing a contrite Lloyd at the wheel. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got room for one more, if you still want to go to Aspen. Harry looks the hearse over. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you find this baby? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used car dealer. I   traded the van for it. Plus I got   the guy to throw in fifty bucks for   gas money. (beat) Come on, man, what   do you say? We still partners?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impatient Detective Dale is still staked-out at the Colorado border with several other officers. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make sense. They should've been here hours ago. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they're smarter than we thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How smart can they be? They're riving a goddamn dog! Another COP rushes over holding his walkie-talkie. COP #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got a report that they were spotted about two hours ago heading east near Des Moines on I-80. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Des Moines?! Why that's five hundred miles from here! COP #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess they got wind of our welcoming party. DT. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're wasting time. Let's mobilize. Dt. Dale heads for his cruiser while the other Cops follo As the officers climb into their cars, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is driving and Harry has his feet out the window. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, Harry. Would you really have kept going home if I hadn't come back to get you? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let me put it this way, Lloyd: Do you remember when we were Cub Scouts and we got lost in the woods uring that blizzard? We huddled together all night, and we made an oath that if we ever got out of there alive we'd never ever leave each other's side again. Do you remember that? Lloyd thinks hard about this. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were never Cub Scouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Just then several COP CARS whiz by them in the opposite direction with SIRENS BLARING and LIGHTS FLASHING. When H glances back at the cop cars, he notices that there's a C in the rear of the vehicle. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? There's a coffin in the back! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, it's empty. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit. I'm not driving anywhere with a casket. You know I'm superstitious calm down. We'll dump it off first chance we get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Lloyd are swerving through traffic in the hears Ahead of them is a REAL FUNERAL PROCESSION. The lead car a CADILLAC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (This is the car right behind the funeral hearse.) A MAN a WOMAN are arguing. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I married a cheapskate. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your trap, Gerdie. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so embarrassed. I'll never be able to show my face again. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew something good would come out of this. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have given him a more ignified burial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle was a cheap man. Remember what he got us for our twenty-fifth? A friggin' fern. There's no way I'm gonna spend a load to get him planted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the couple ARGUES ON, Harry and Lloyd cut in front them. The Man and the Woman on't notice this an soon the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Lloyd pull up to a large green dumpster behind market. The procession comes to a halt behind them. The g get out of the hearse and remove the coffin from the back Then they unceremoniously HEAVE THE COFFIN INTO THE DUMPS

dialogues.speaker: OFF.
dialogues.text: ON THE LEAD CAR OF THE PROCESSION - The Woman's jaw is practically on the floor. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch! I want a ivorce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse drives past a sign that says ENTERING ASPEN, COLORADO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys stroll down the sidewalk, looking in the windows studying the passersby, taking in the sights and sounds o the ski town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this wonderful? What more could a couple of single guys like us ask for? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about food and shelter? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so materialistic. (beat) Why don't we get down to business and eliver the briefcase to Mary. Who knows, maybe she'll invite us in for tea and a strumpet or two? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolly good idea, chap. And where oes the lovely young lady reside? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... good question. Harry throws Lloyd a concerned look, but then notices a p booth next to them. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what's her last name? We'll look it up in the phone book. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm... You know, I don't believe I caught that either. Harry's concern grows. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the briefcase, Lloyd? There must've been a name on it, right? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening) Come to think of it, there is. It's engraved right into the leather. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samsonite   spelled just like it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry starts flipping through the phone book. Then abrupt HE STOPS and puts the book down, a DEFEATED look on his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is parked in a parking lot across the street from picturesque bridge. Harry and Lloyd are shivering in the front seat as a LOUD, ICY WIND WHIPS though the hearse. They're each spooning something out of a coffee cup and sipping it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any soup left? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little. Shall we share it? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Lloyd opens a TINY KETCHUP PACKET and squirts half of it into Harry's cup and the other half into his. They pour a few drops of water in and mix it with their spoons. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm mmmm good... Lloyd smiles bravely at Harry. Harry notices something an leans toward him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you got something stuck in your front teeth. Lloyd picks a small speck out of his mouth and studies it LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... looks like an old piece of Beef Jerky.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY STARES AT IT. THEN
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna split it? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pathetic. Get your own. Loyd puts the floss-meat back in his mouth and chews it. Another gust of wind swirls around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm freezing my ass off, Lloyd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll up your window. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is rolled up. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess the damn anti-cold system isn't working. You really should get it fixed if we're gonna live here all winter. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What anti-cold system? Lloyd points to the dash. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here the A/C button. I put it on full blast about an hour ago and, if anything, the car's getting colder. Harry stares at Lloyd and then throws down his cup, disgu He opens the car door and starts to climb out. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going out there for? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To warm up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry gets out and leans against the car with his arms crossed. Lloyd comes from around the other side. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you worrying about now? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about how you're gonna survive the pummeling I'm about to give you. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Suddenly Harry LUNGES at Lloyd, who takes off around the other side of the car. Harry leaps across the hood, but L manages to evade his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, calm down! You're acting like a wild animal! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here and take your medicine, Lloyd! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, doc, I can't take medicine. I'm a Christian Scientist! Lloyd continues to outrun him around the car. Frustrated, Harry opens the car and PULLS THE BRIEFCASE OUT. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I should've done a long time ago. This stupid thing has been the root of our problems all along. Harry starts walking toward the bridge spanning a river. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything foolish, Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foolish? This is the most sensible thing I've done in years. I'm gonna toss this goddamn curse right into that river. Lloyd starts to follow after Harry. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making a big mistake, Harry! I'll never forgive you for this! Harry keeps marching toward the bridge, determined to dis of the briefcase. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, hold up! Things are gonna get better, I promise! In fact, I think I feel another piece of Beef Jerky in my left molar! It's yours, Harry, all yours! Harry stops in his tracks, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bluffing. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not, man look. Lloyd pulls his cheek back, revealing a molar. Harry squi at it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a filling, you liar! Just then, Lloyd makes a dash at Harry. Harry turns and r but Lloyd TACKLES HIM as they reach the bridge. The brief GOES FLYING, and the guys wrestle pitifully with one anot in the snow, rolling over and over. Finally, Harry manages to get the upper hand. He climbs o top and CLASPS HIS HANDS AROUND LLOYD'S THROAT. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to have a life! A miserable one, but a life, nonetheless! Suddenly Lloyd's EYES LIGHT UP as he sees something O.S. behind his friend. LLOYD (CHOKED VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, look! Harry turns and HIS EYES LIGHT UP, TOO. He lets go of Llo as we see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Lloyd are hurrying down the sidewalk, clutching the briefcase. The city is lit up with millions of tiny lights, like a fantasy winter wonderland. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's the plan: We borrow a few bucks just a small loan from the briefcase, and we check into a cheap motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we'll keep track of the money we spend with IOUs. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be meticulous    right down to the last penny. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way, whatever we borrow we can pay back. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. We're good for it. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, as soon as we get jobs. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come right out of our first paycheck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tuxedoed Bell Captain, BARNARD, is showing the guys aro an ENORMOUS AND LUXURIOUS SUITE. The place is big enough throw a touchdown bomb in. BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is the Hotel Danbury's Presidential Suite, gentlemen. It's normally reserved for royalty, visiting dignitaries, and illustrious stars of stage and take it. The Bell Captain is a bit taken aback, but pleased. BARNARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir. Are there any bags you'd like sent up? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Barnard, but we'll find our own chicks. BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peevish) I wasn't talking about ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Then go ahead and send thim up. What are their names? Barnard SIGHS. BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I meant your luggage. Harry forces a. embarrassed half-smile. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what you can send up, my friend how about some chow? The Bell Captain nods. BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring you a menu. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother. Just order us one of everything. At this, Harry serves Lloyd a reproachful look. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of everything? Lloyd... Lloyd looks guilty. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. (beat) Make that two of everything. Harry smiles at this as Lloyd pulls a wad of HUNDRED DOLL BILLS out of his pocket. He rips one off and tucks it in Barnard's top pocket. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here you go, Barney. You keep us happy, we'll keep you happy. The Bell Captain, Barnard, is energized by this tip. BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir! He bows and leaves the room. Then Lloyd cracks open the briefcase and inserts a SMALL PIECE OF PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Our first IOU. Signed and dated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen Swanson is KNOCKING on her step-daughter's bedroom door. She's holding a tray with a couple of mugs on it. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary? You awake? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) COME IN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is sitting in a chair looking sadly out the French windows when Helen ENTERS. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you some tea. I thought it might help you relax. Mary smiles. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She takes a mug, sips, and pulls back. MARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yech! What's in this, whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, sorry... that one's mine. Helen grabs the mug from Mary and hands her the other one HELEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling any better, honey? Mary can't take her eyes from the window. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just knowing that Melvin's out there, being held by God knows who... (fighting back tears) It's all my fault. I should've been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You can't blame yourself for this. If you'd been there they would've taken you, too. Helen pulls out a joint and torches it up. She takes a hi MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just pay them the money again and get this thing over with. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Mary, everything that can be done is being done. You've got to stop torturing yourself. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do? Go about my life as if everything were fine? HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what you should do. Get the hell out more, go skiing, socialize. Don't you see, honey? We can't let on that anything is wrong. If the press or authorities get wind of this, the kidnappers might panic. (beat) Who knows what they'd do to poor Melvin then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guys pull up to the front of the hotel in the hearse. Several HOTEL EMPLOYEES rush to help them. Harry and Lloy get out wearing OVERLY TRENDY SKI GARB, complete with fur boots, NASA designed goggles, and splashy fluorescent col everywhere. The Employees all grab the shopping bags and then line up as Lloyd TIPS THEM ALL handsomely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge beds are covered in boxes and bags of new goodie Lloyd is going through it all. Harry is sitting out on th balcony with his feet up on the railing, checking out the mountain view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, it's really true. Last night I thought I might've been dreaming. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no dream, Har. We finally cracked the big time. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was so simple. All it took was somebody else's money. Harry LIGHTS A CIGAR WITH A TWENTY DOLLAR BILL, takes a h puff, and EXHALES. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Lloyd, I think you might've gone a little overboard with the spending today. He blows out the twenty and tosses it off the balcony. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big deal? We're gonna pay it all back anyway, right? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, but do you really think you needed to buy those two surfboards? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surfboards? I thought those were beginner's skis. This suddenly makes sense to Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. I was wondering why you had those bindings put on them. Lloyd opens a box and holds up a SCANTY NEGLIGEE. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd this come from? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) I bought it. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the feel of it against my skin... (defensive) ...I mean, you know, when a woman's wearing it. Lloyd inspects it more closely. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, how many women do you know who wear a size XXL? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, leave me alone. I'm rich now. I'm supposed to have a few eccentricities. There's a KNOCK on the door. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter, parlez vous! The Bell Captain, Barnard, ENTERS with a champagne bucket and a newspaper under his arm. BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you your newspaper and some champagne, gentlemen. Unfortunately, we didn't seem to have the, um, label you requested. Lloyd examines the champagne's label and frowns. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All out of Boone's Farm, huh? BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a rapier wit, sir. I took the liberty of bringing a comparable substitute: Dom Perignon. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it'll have to do, slugger, eh? Lloyd smiles and over tips him. BARNARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much, sir. He puts the tray down, hands Lloyd the newspaper, and hea for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, one more thing: You can     dispense with the 'sir' crap. Let's     face it, Barney, we're all from the     same mold. (winks) We just have a little more     dough than you right now. Barnard smiles and EXITS. Harry comes back in the room. H picks up a champagne glass and flicks it with his finger, sending out a resonant RING. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocktail hour has commenced! He starts to open the champagne bottle as Lloyd begins thumbing through the newspaper. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, later on what do you say we...? He notices that Lloyd's mouth has dropped open at somethi he's found in the paper. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd... you okay? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbstruck) Harry, it's her. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary with the briefcase. This is her... He shoves the newspaper at Harry. CLOSE ON THE HEADLINE - it reads: SWANSONS TO HOST PRESERVATION GALA TONIGHT; CITY'S ELITE EXPECTED. Underne this is a photograph of Mary with her parents. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Swanson... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cinderella, it's time to get you ready for the ball... Roy Orbison's "Pretty Woman" plays over a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -The boys are in a beauty parlor getting their hair shamp -Harry and Lloyd sit beneath old-fashioned hair dryers. T ATTENDANTS lift the dryers from their heads, revealing bo guys' hair in curlers. -Lloyd's getting shaved by an ATTENDANT with a straight-r Suddenly Lloyd grabs his neck as if he's been nicked. BLOOD SQUIRTS OUT from between hi fingers. The other CUSTOMERS stare in horror at this. Llo LAUGHS and shows everyone a SQUEEZE KETCHUP BOTTLE hidden his hand. Only Harry and Lloyd seem to find this joke amu -We see them getting their nose hairs clipped. PAN DOWN t the floor to reveal a PILE OF NOSE HAIR CLIPPINGS. -Then a   shot of a MAN next to them getting a pedicure. OVER to   Lloyd's bare feet  he has toe nails like Howard Hughes.   Sparks are flying as an ATTENDANT wearing safet goggles   tries to sand down Lloyd's toenails with an ele sander. -Harry is lying on his stomach with his shirt off, gettin massage from a beautiful ORIENTAL MASSEUSE. He pulls a hu dollar bill from under his towel, hands it to her, and WHISPERS in her ear. She smiles. -Next we see the Oriental Masseuse lying on her stomach w her shirt off, while Harry happily massages her back. -The guys are in an expensive haberdashery. Harry comes o of the dressing room in a very elegant BLACK TUXEDO. He couldn't look any more suave. The SALEMAN nods, impressed but Lloyd shakes his head no and Harry goes back in. -Harry reappears in another stylish WHITE TUXEDO. The Sal looks on hopefully, but Lloyd again disapproves. -This time Harry comes out in a JUNIOR-PROM-LIKE SKY-BLUE TUXEDO, complete with TACKY FRILLS. The Salesman looks sickened as Lloyd give Harry the thumbs up. PAN ACROSS THE STREET from the haberdashery - an apprehen J.P. Shay is sitting in a parked car, WATCHING HARRY AND LLOYD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throngs of GUESTS in black-tie and elegant gowns are ente the building. Suddenly the hearse pulls up with Harry and Lloyd BUMPER SURFING BEHIND IT. Harry's wearing his blue tuxedo. Lloyd's tux isn't any better it's pumpkin orange. (THEY'VE GOT MATCHING TOP HATS AND CANES.) When the hears stops, the boys hand the driver Barnard a couple hundred dollars. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the lift, Barney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas Andre is greeting people at the door. However, w Harry and Lloyd try to enter, he stops them and gives the the once over. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentlemen, but this is a five-hundred-dollar-a-plate dinner. Harry and Lloyd look at each other and shrug. Then Lloyd takes out a WAD OF BILLS and peels off TEN HUNDREDS, much to the amazement of Andre. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should cover a couple plates. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kind of hungry, Lloyd. What if we want seconds? Lloyd thinks about this. Then he peels off another thou. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put us down for four plates, my good man. They ENTER the party. As Andre watches them go, his assoc J.P. Shay comes up beside him, an alarmed look on his fac J.P. SHAY (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, boss... it's them. BACK ON HARRY AND LLOYD - the guys make their way through the affluent crowd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting nervous, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: relax, Lloyd. These people are just like you and me. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? They're educated, well-bred, charming, and sophisticated. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? We can be sophistica holy shit, would you look at the fun bags on that hose hound. He points out a busty BLONDE BOMBSHELL entering the party Lloyd rolls his eyes. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to me, Harry. I'm already a wreck. What if Mary oesn't like me? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, let's just go saddle up to the bar and down a couple bowls of loudmouth soup. A little booze'll bring back that old Lloyd Christmas over-confidence. The guys stand out at the glittering social scene as they make their way to the bar. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to BARTENDER) Two martinis, straight up. As Harry and Lloyd silently take in the party, a BEAUTIFU RED HEAD reaches between them for a cocktail napkin, then walks away. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say anything. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I know what you were gonna say and I'm telling you to shut up in advance. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know what I was gonna say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read you like a book. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if you read me like a book then what was I gonna say? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gonna say: (in Harry's looped

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: 'That's one fiery bush I wouldn't mind roasting my weenie in.' Harry raises his eyebrows, IMPRESSED. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I would say 'shut up', because this is our chance to get in with the rich and powerful and you don't ingratiate yourself to the kind of people by acting like Ron Jeremy on Spanish Fly. The Bartender delivers their martinis as we hear the o.s. CLINKING of a glass. The guys turns to see Nicholas Andre standing at a podium. Next to him is a LARGE, COVERED DISPLAY. On his other side are Karl and Elizabeth Swanson. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could have your attention, please... The crowd QUIETS. ANDRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to thank you all for coming to this very special event. As you

dialogues.speaker: KNOW, THE ASPEN PRESERVATION SOCIETY -
dialogues.text: founded and chiefly funded by our great benefactors, Karl and Helen Swanson - is the world's foremost efender of endangered species. Our

dialogues.speaker: SPRAWLING GROUNDS ARE HOME TO TWENTY-
dialogues.text: three separate varieties of animals that are currently li on the United Nation's charter of protected species. Toni we are deeply honored to have Mr. Karl Swanson welcome ou twenty-fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd CLAPS as Mr. Swanson takes Andre's place at the podium. MR. SWANSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the Icelandic Snow Owl. He pulls the cover off, revealing TWO MAJESTIC, FLUFFY WH OWLS IN A CAGE. Everyone OOHS and AHHS. MR. SWANSON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These magnificent specimens were

dialogues.speaker: RESCUED RECENTLY, CULMINATING A FIVE-
dialogues.text: year, two-million-dollar effort on our part. Together, th constitute one-seventh of the snow owl population left on the planet. ON ANDRE - he's nervously eyeing Harry and Lloyd. He look pale. MR. SWANSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here these lovely birds will be allowed to breed in a natural but protected habitat. And, God willing, with your help and that of the Society's, we will see these wonderful creatures flourish once more. More APPLAUSE. MR. SWANSON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, thank you, and enjoy your evening. Oh, and feel free to take a closer look at our new friends here. Enjoy. The crowd APPLAUDS and begins to mingle again. Lloyd turn back to the Bartender and holds up his empty glass. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more, please. Harry stares at Lloyd with concern. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd, I've never seen you this uptight. You've gotta chill out. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. This is a very important night for me. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Harry, have you ever wondered why you and I never have long-term girlfriends? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I went out with Fraida Felcher for two and a half weeks. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a fluke. (beat) The reason we never have long-term girlfriends is because of one thing: We're afraid of the C word. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy. We live for the C word. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking bout commitment. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Oh. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm ready for commitment, Harry. The first time I laid eyes on Mary Swanson, I knew she was the one. (beat) Some things you feel in your heart, other things you feel in your groin. This girl makes me feel it all in the heart. Suddenly Lloyd notices something across the room.

dialogues.speaker: OF GUESTS. SHE'S WEARING A
dialogues.text: spectacular black cocktail dress. Lloyd quickly turns toward the bar. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, there she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking her out) Wow. You weren't kidding, Lloyd. She's an angel. (beat) Well, what are you waiting for? Get over there and talk to her. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna think I'm some kind of psycho when she realizes how far I came just to see her. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have her briefcase she's gonna be thrilled to see you. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what? She'll take it back and that'll be it. I'm a nobody. Harry thinks about this a moment. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, you just drove two thousand miles to see this girl. Don't quit on the last fifty feet. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening) Wait a second, I have an idea. You go over and introduce yourself. That way you can build me up so when I come along I won't have to brag about myself. Tell her I'm good-looking and I'm rich and I have a rapist's wit. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell her you're good looking, Lloyd she's got eyes. Lloyd takes a big gulp of his new martini. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Harry, I'm appealing to you as one loser to another. Just build me up and then give me a signal to come over. Please. Harry SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. But you're gonna owe me a big one for this. Harry straightens his polka-dot bow-tie, then APPROACHES Mary, who is now standing alone, admiring the owls. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice set of hooters you got there. Mary turns to Harry, stunned. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The owls. They're beautiful. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. (beat) Are you a bird lover? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I used to have a parakeet, but my main area of expertise is canines that's dogs to the layperson. She smiles at this. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I love dogs, too. So how are you involved with them? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I've trained them, bathed them, clipped them; I've even bred them. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Any unusual breeding? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, mostly just doggie-style. But one time we successfully mated a Bulldog and a Shitzu. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? That's weird. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We called it a Bullshit. (breaks out LAUGHING) Just a little breeder joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems strangely charmed by this. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, the real reason I came over is because I want to introduce you to a friend of mine. Just then, Mary's stepmother approaches. She's holding a martini and looking a little sloshed. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, I don't believe I've met your friend. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we haven't been introduced yet. (holds out hand) I'm Mary Swanson, and this is my stepmother, Helen. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Dunne. Pleasure meeting you both. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you come in earlier, Mr. Dunne. I was hoping we'd get a chance to meet. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) You were? HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tuxedo I love a man with a sense of humor. So does Mary. Mary shoots Helen a look, then smiles at Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? For a moment, he's caught up in Mary's eyes, but then man to snap out of it. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, about my friend you doing anything tomorrow, Mr. Dunne? Because I believe Mary's looking for somebody to hit the slopes with. Whuh? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, you're embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you are, aren't you? (to Harry) Poor girl doesn't get out enough. So what do you say, Harry? Are you available? Harry thinks about this, then looks across the room at a hopeful Lloyd. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. You see, my friend your friends for one day. You and Mary will have a ball. Mary's captivating eyes meet his, waiting for an answer. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... well... I don't know. You see, the thing is... sure. ON LLOYD - he waits impatiently at the bar as Harry retur LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you didn't call me over? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, you're golden. I got you a ate with her tomorrow. Lloyd falls back against the bar and grabs his chest. He' SPEECHLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... you... I... it's... (smiles) I love you, man. I love you! Lloyd clamps an embarrassed Harry in a TIGHT EMBRACE. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, get a grip, Lloyd. You're making a scene. Lloyd steps back elated. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This calls for a toast! He grabs a bottle of champagne out of a bucket and starts open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be my best man, Har, I mean it. It was always between you and my future wife's brother, but you just earned a seat at the head table, pal. Suddenly the CORK SHOOTS OUT OF THE CHAMPAGNE BOTTLE AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYED OWLS. In quick succession we hear a BOK!, a SQUAWK!, and a THUMP! A HUSH falls over the entire party as everyone turns thei stunned attention to the cage.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, AND ONE OF THE ICELANDIC SNOW
dialogues.text: Owls LIES ON ITS BACK, its species now one bird closer to extinction. Harry and Lloyd look on in horror. Harry takes the smokin champagne bottle from Lloyd and places it on the bar. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath) I think we've done enough hobnobbing, Lloyd. The guys LOWER THEIR HEADS and slink out of the room befo anyone can figure out what happened anyone except for Nicholas Andre, that is; we PAN to show that he's been standing nearby watching their every move. And he doesn't look very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas Andre is pacing the room with a drink in his han while J.P. Shay looks on nervously. J.P. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was just a coincidence. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. It's a message, plain and simple: We killed their bird, now they killed ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.P. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how could anybody off a bird with a cork? ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys arent' just anybody. They're good. Look what they did to Mental. He was the best, and yet he fell right into their web. J.P. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the bastards already got our money. What the hell more could they want? Andre runs his fingers through his hair. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at wit's end) I don't know, god damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jubilant Lloyd is fixing his hair in the mirror. In the b.g., Harry is putting on his new ski clothes including a pair of thermal tights. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Christmas... Mary Christmas... Mrs. Mary Christmas. You know, it has kind of a ring to it, oesn't it, Har? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds nice, Lloyd, but don't you think you may be jumping the gun a little? I mean, who knows, when you get to know her, you may find out she's not your type. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible. I know my type    when I see it. Now let me get this    straight, she wants me to meet her at    the Avalanche Bar and Grill on    Main Street? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she said. Ten o'clock sharp. This is when Lloyd notices Harry's get-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time out. Where are going ressed like that. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, thought while you were making your love connection I'd try my luck on the slopes. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you're gonna go out in public dressed in tights? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These aren't tights. They're fashionable Euro-trash ski trousers. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can see the outline of your who-who. Harry looks down at his crotch. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn sideways. Harry turns his profile against the window. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's just a tiny little lump. No one will ever notice. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I can't go out dressed like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING SHOT of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are putting their boots on and their skis are line up on the wall behind them. Mary is waiting by the firepl in an incredibly sexy snowsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Harry appears in the room, dressed ridiculously. he begins to clumsily make his way through the lodge towa Mary, we see that he ALREADY HAS HIS SKIS ON. He kicks ov a row of skis and gets glares from all sides. Finally he reaches her, OUT OF BREATH. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. It's a bitch driving a clutch with these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Mary are at the front of the lift line. The cou ahead of them get on a chair, and then they shuffle into position. Harry crouches nervously, waiting for the chair The chair swings around, comes up behind them, and makes smooth pick up of Mary, that is. An embarrassed Harry is STILL IN THE CROUCHING POSITION, having missed the ride. Mary looks back at him, confused. Suddenly he pretends to stretching. HARRY (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take the first run alone. I'm gonna loosen up down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. AVALANCHE BAR & GRILL - DAY Lloyd ENTERS the bar as the WAITERS are setting up for th day. WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, we don't open until eleven. This is disconcerting news to Lloyd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm meeting someone. Mind if I wait at the bar? The Waiter shrugs and Lloyd sits down at the empty bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Mary are now sitting together on a chair as it rises higher and higher toward the imposing mountain top. Harry holds onto the chair's frame nervously. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful day, huh, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glorious. Mary takes a DEEP BREATH. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it feels so good to get up here. I haven't been outdoors much in the last couple of weeks. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evasive) There's been... family problems. I on't want to bore you with them. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. He looks mindlessly off in the distance. Then Harry notic a PATCH OF FROST on the chair lift bar. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look... frost. He licks it and his TONGUE IMMEDIATELY FUSES WITH THE FRO METAL. He tugs a few times, but it won't budge. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lisping) Sure. I do this all the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mary and Harry arrive at the top of the lift, Mary disembarks but Harry stays on. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lisping) See ya at the bottom... Harry and the chair lift swing around and start heading d the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair lift comes back around with Harry still sitting it, stuck to the bar. Two LITTLE KIDS climb on with him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lisping) Hi. (off their looks) Say, kids, you wouldn't happen to have a cup of warm water, would you? The two kids just stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. AVALANCHE BAR & GRILL - AFTERNOON A despondent   Lloyd's got a couple of empties in front o now. The bar   is open and there are a few CUSTOMERS spri about. Lloyd   takes a sip of his drink and looks up at t clock on the   wall. It's 12:30. We see a pair of beautiful legs slide onto the stool next him. PAN OVER to reveal that it's the Athletic Beauty tha Harry had tried to pick up at the truck stop. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Lloyd GRUNTS a hello. ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad day, huh? Lloyd GRUNTS once more. ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) well don't worry, Mercury's supposed to be coming out or retrograde tonight. Things will get better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary gracefully carves her way to the bottom of the hill stops with a snow-spraying flourish. She looks around the outdoor patio for Harry. She spots something and does a D TAKE.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIR LIFT
dialogues.text: has been removed from the cable). He's drinking a cup of coffee and trying to act nonchalant, espite the gawking o the other SKIERS. There's a MIME performing in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god. Harry, are you okay? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lisping) I'm fine, I'm fine. It'll come off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP of Harry's head through a RIFLE SCOPE. REVERSE A to reveal J.P. Shay a few hundred feet up the hill with a high-powered rifle trained on Harry. SHAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're luck just ran out, pal. As his trigger finger TWITCHES with anticipation, we go

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is silly. Let me help you... Mary gets up and stands behind Harry. He MOANS nervously. She grabs his head in both hands and starts pulling it aw from the bar. We see HARRY'S TONGUE STRETCH RIDICULOUSLY. FIVE INCHES... SIX... THEN EIGHT. Harry GROANS in pain. S his TONGUE COMES UNDONE and Harry and Mary fall backwards out of the path of J.P. Shay's bullet as it WHIZZES BY. W hear the Mime in the b.g. CRY OUT in pain: MIME

dialogues.speaker: GODDAMN IT
dialogues.text: The poor Mime holds his bleeding hand and retreats nervou into the lodge as the CROWD BOOS him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. AVALANCHE BAR & GRILL - AFTERNOON Lloyd's now swimming in despair, as the Athletic Beauty RAMBLES ON beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATHLETIC BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anyway, after my boyfriend backed into my garage for the third time, I said to myself, 'Run, Cathy, run for your life before he kills you both'. Then you know what the klutz does and to be perfectly honest, I on't really care. (beat) Look, I'm sorry, but I'm not very good company today. I'll say. (beat) I have an idea. Why don't you tell me a little about yourself. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some other time. Lloyd motions for the BARTENDER. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, you wouldn't happen to know a Mary Swanson, would you? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Her family comes in here all the time. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where she lives? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they got that big place up on Alpine Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse pulls up to the house and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to tell you, today was really just what I needed. Thanks a lot, Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure, Mary. She beams and gives him a KISS on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll pick me up tonight at 7:45? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better make it quarter to eight. I've got a few things to take care of first. Harry watches, lovestruck, as Mary gets out of the car an walks toward the house. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Mary Dunne... Mrs. Mary Dunne... Got a nice ring to it. We PAN from the hearse to some nearby bushes, where we se

dialogues.speaker: WATCHING ALL THIS IN DISBELIEF.
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some best man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE of Lloyd walking through the hills of Aspen, tota BUMMED OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is sitting forlornly on the bed while Harry feigns surprise at what he's just heard. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any sense, Lloyd. She told me ten o'clock sharp. Are you sure you went to the right bar? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, it was the right place. (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Har, maybe she just had second thoughts. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a hard time believing that, Lloyd. The girl said she couldn't wait to see you again. Harry paces back and forth when suddenly SOMETHING OCCURE TO HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just occurred to me. She must've meant ten o'clock at night. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening) Do ya think...? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! Why would she have you meet her at a bar at ten in the morning? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) I just figured she was a raging alcoholic. Harry BARKS OUT A LAUGH at their stupidity. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, aren't we a couple of beauties? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew there was an explanation. And here I thought she was standing me up. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll teach you to jump to conclusions. (beat) Anyway, since you have your night all planned, I think I'll run out and catch a flick. As Harry walks into the closet to change, Lloyd clenches fist and glares after him. Then he regains his composure moves to the bar. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join me in a good luck toast before you head out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Sure thing, pal. Whatever you think will help your chances. Lloyd BITES HIS LIP at this. He fills two mugs with coffe and throws a splash of Bailey's in each. He check to make sure Harry is still in the closet, then pulls out a BOX O EX-LAX. LLOYD DUMPS THE ENTIRE PACK INTO ONE MUG AND MIXES IT IN.

dialogues.speaker: TIE, LLOYD DOES A DOUBLE-
dialogues.text: take. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty snazzed out for a movie, aren't you? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... it's for mature audiences. I on't wanna chance getting turned away at the door. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Lloyd hands him the mug with the Ex-Lax. Then he lifts hi own glass. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my friend Harry the matchmaker. Harry feels a pang of guilt but drinks up anyway. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm... He GULPS DOWN THE DRINK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's driving along, WHISTLING happily to himself in anticipation of the night. Suddenly we hear a LOW, INTEST RUMBLE. He reacts and rubs his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse parks on the street and Harry gets out. He's walking up the steps to the house when we hear more GASEO THUNDER from his stomach. Harry stops in his tracks, gets his insides under control, and continues to the front por where he RINGS the bell. Mary answers the door, fiddling with her earrings. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry follows her inside. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself at home. I'm almost ready. Just give me one more minute. As she disappears down a hallway, we hear Harry's UPSET STOMACH again. He notices a bathroom off the hallway and rushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD ON Harry's face as he quickly pulls his pants down a nestles onto the throne. He lets out a SIGH OF RELIEF as does his business, then leans over and SLIDES OPEN THE WI to air the room out. He's still glued to the toilet when hears a KNOCK on the door. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Are you in there, Harry? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Be right out. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) I hope you're not using the toilet. It's broken. ZOOM IN TIGHT on Harry's face - his EYES GO WIDE and a vi SWEAT breaks out on his forehead. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) It doesn't flush. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no, I was just... shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confused Mary is standing outside the bathroom door. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaving? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Yeah! I was running a little late. Thought this would save time. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Well I'll be in the living room whenever you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's got his pants back on and is lifting the lid off toilet tank. He starts tinkering with a few valves. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath) Come on, flush, you bastard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary's sitting patiently on the couch with her legs cross She looks at her watch, then flips on the TV. ON THE TUBE - the news is on. A WOMAN REPORTER is address the CAMERA gravely: REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back in a minute with the story of the blind Indiana boy who was duped into buying a dead parakeet. We see Billy the blind boy from apartment 4-C sitting in his wheelchair, holding up Petey the parakeet with its he Scotch taped on its body. BLIND BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I thought he was real quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporter shakes her head and they go to a commercial. Mary SHIVERS at this and turns off the television. Sudden the DOORBELL RINGS. She gets up and opens the front door. HER POV - a dapper Lloyd is standing there in his new Asp chic clothes. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (beat) Don't you remember me? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... I'm not really... LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South Bend. I drove you to the airport last week. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dawning on her) Oh my god. Lloyd, right? Lloyd is thrilled at this. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remembered. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in Aspen? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you your briefcase You left it at the airport so I picked it up for you. Mary's MOUTH DROPS OPEN. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who took my briefcase? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's back at my hotel room. Come on, let's take a ride. I'll give it to you. Mary is torn between getting her briefcase and waiting fo Harry. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the bathroom door. Inside we hear the LOUD CLANKING of metal against metal. MARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, what are you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's got the eintire toilet completely DISASSEMBLED no Various pieces of the commode litter the floor, including the big plastic float ball. He's on his knees tinkering w some pipes coming out of the wall. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... just cleaning my teeth. Give me a minute, Mary, I'll be right with you. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Sorry, but something important's come up and I have to run out. It's sort of an emergency. I'll explain later. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mary -- MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) --I'm really sorry, Harry. I promise we'll do this another time. Harry hears her FOOTSTEPS echo down the hallway and then front DOOR CLOSING. Harry slumps against the sink, defeat HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is in the passenger seat, wearing a subtle, SATISFI SMILE. An anxious looking Mary is at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jaguar pulls up in front of the hotel. As Lloyd and M get out, we PAN OVER to reveal that they were being follo by Nicholas Andre and J.P. Shay in a Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre pulls a PISTOL from beneath his seat and slips it i his coat. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Lloyd and Mary ENTER. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..So anyway, as soon as I got to town I tried to look you up but I idn't know your last name. He leads her to the closed BRIEFCASE which is sitting on bed. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. You really have it. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course I have it. When Lloyd Christmas drives a woman to the airport, he makes sure she gets all her luggage, no matter what he has to o. Mary looks at Lloyd and smiles. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is incredible. You mean to say you drove two thousand miles just for me? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... no... I mean, you know, there were other reasons... (beat) Actually, yeah, I guess I did. She can't believe her ears. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the sweetest thing I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops his head and Mary leans over and kisses him on t cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sullen Harry is driving back to the hotel. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MUMBLING to himself) It's all Kharma, Harry. You screw your best friend over and it's gonna come back to haunt you, plain and simple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON LLOYD'S FACE - he's starry-eyed in love as he sp his guts. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mary, I know this may seem a little sudden but I've given it a lot of thought: You're the woman I've been waiting for my whole life, and I'm not ashamed to admit it -- (holds up his hand) --Please, let me finish. (DEEP BREATH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm crazy about you. I've never felt this way about anyone. You make it so easy for me to tell you my innermost desires. (NERVOUS LAUGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, I feel like a schoolboy again. (beat) A schoolboy who desperately wants to make sweet, sweet love to you. Suddenly we hear   TOILET FLUSHING O.S. REVERSE ANGLE REVEALS that Lloyd has been talking to an E CHAIR. The bathroom oor opens and Mary comes out. She loo around, expecting to see someone else. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I thought I heard you talking to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is flustered. He swallows hard. It's the moment of truth. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary... (BLURTING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I desperately want to make love to a schoolboy. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Maybe I should be going now. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not what Imeant. I meant... I really like you, Mary. I like you a lot. She smiles at this. LLOYD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna ask you something flat out and I want you to answer me honestly: What do you think the chances are of a girl like you and a guy like me ending up together? Mary is obviously thrown by this question. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd, that's difficult to say. I mean we hardly -- LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I asked you to be honest, Mary. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lloyd, I really can't -- LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Come    on, give it to me straight. I rove a    long way to see you, the least you can    do is level with me. What are my    chances? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean not good, like one out of a hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say more like one out of a million.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Duh) So you're telling me there's a chance? Just then, there's a KNOCK at the door. When Lloyd opens he's face to face with Nicholas Andre. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas... what are you doing here? ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you, Mary. I've got some interesting news about your husband. Lloyd looks at MAry, devastated. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband? ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you two going to invite me in? Lloyd and Mary hear a CLICK and turn to see Andre POINTIN GUN at them. Andre steps into the room, and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry mopes through the lobby, we hear someone CALL OU WOMAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Hey! Harry turns to see the Athletic Beauty approaching. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas Andre has his gun pointed at a stunned Lloyd and Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well at least you two got to say your goodbyes. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play dumb with me, asshole. I'm the rightful ower of that briefcase you've been carrying. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Mary can't believe what's happening. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas, you... you motherfucker! My family trusted you! ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, sir, about the briefcase, I want you to know, my friend Harry and I have every intention of reimbursing you. Andre looks alarmed. He motions Mary to the briefcase wit his gun. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open that damn thing! Mary opens the briefcase and a pile of WHITE, CRUMPLED-UP BALLS OF PAPER fall out along with a few packets of hundr ANDRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's this? Where's all the money? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's as good as money, sir. Those are our IOUs. You can add them up yourself. Every penny's accounted for. Andre looks like his head is about to BURST in anger. ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't do anything hasty, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry gets out of the elevator and lets himself into the Presidential Suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry ENTERS looking contrite and CALLS OUT: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd, are you home? We've gotta talk, man. I have a serious confession to make. Harry comes around the corner and STOPS COLD. HIS POV - Lloyd and Mary are lying on the bed, their arms handcuffed to the bedpost. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good, you found her. I'll just leave you two kids alone. Harry turns to go, but bumps into the MUZZLE OF ANDRE'S G ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you stay and join the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is sitting beside Lloyd and Mary on the bed. Nichol Andre keeps his gun trained on them while he SPEAKS on th phone: ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I want a one-way ticket to Rio De Janerio departing as soon as possible... ON THE BED - Harry and Lloyd can't look each other in the eye. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting) Yeah, we used to be best friends. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until he turned into a backstabber. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me a backstabber? You got a lot of nerve. I saw her first. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I couldn't help it if she found me irresistable. Mary ROLLS HER EYES at this. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you knew how crazy I was about her. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you knew how crazy I was about Fraida Felcher, but that didn't stop you, did it? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waning righteousness) What are you talking about? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
